text: 12 CONCURRENCY CONTROL PROTOCOL Two-phase locking (2PL) is a concurrency control protocol that determines whether a txn is allowed to access an object in the database on the fly. The protocol does not need to know all of the queries that a txn will execute ahead of time. l,, 4 2n .@ 13:3/1:18:13 * TwoPhase Locking > n [ec] Q E] [t CMU Database Systems - 17 Two-Phase Locking Concurrency Control (Fall 2018)
